intro: Ophionella arcuata subsp. mirkinii, commonly known as the Mirkin's goldenbush, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense clusters. It thrives in arid or semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
